java112.analyzer

Class BigWordAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java112.analyzer.BigWordAnalyzer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Analyzer

    public class BigWordAnalyzer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Analyzer
    The Big Word Analyzer Class will store unique tokens that are big
    Author:
    sschwert

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getBigWordLength() 
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getBigWords()
      This is the get method for the bigWords instance variable
      int getBigWordsCount()
      This is the get method for the count of all the big words
      void printBigWords(java.io.PrintWriter writer)
      the printBigWords method writes each token in the bigWords Set (by calling the get method) to the file and prints the number of big words to the command line (by calling the getBigWordsCount method)
      void processToken(java.lang.String word)
      The process token method is from the interface and will test the tokens/words as they arrive from AnalyzeFile and add tokens to the bigWords array if they are big
      void writeOutputFile(java.lang.String inputFilePath)
      The writeOutputFile method is from the interface and will call the method that will create a file containing all of the big words from the file

      • printBigWords

        public void printBigWords(java.io.PrintWriter writer)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        the printBigWords method writes each token in the bigWords Set (by calling the get method) to the file and prints the number of big words to the command line (by calling the getBigWordsCount method)
        Parameters:
        writer - is a PrintWriter
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - from the print writer, to be dealt with later...

        public int getBigWordsCount()
        This is the get method for the count of all the big words
        Returns:
        bigWordsCount which is the count of each unique item in the bigWords Set
